Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Hydriodic \Hy`dri*od"ic\, a. [Hydr- + iodic: cf. F. hydriodique.] (Chem.) Pertaining to, or derived from, hydrogen and iodine; -- said of an acid ({HI}) produced by the combination of these elements. [1913 Webster]
{Hydriodic acid} (Chem.), a pungent, colorless gas, {HI}, usually prepared as a solution in water. It is strong reducing agent. Called also {hydrogen iodide}. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: Virtual Entity of Relevant Acronyms (Version 1.9, June 2002)

Definition.WordDefinition: hi n 1: an expression of greeting; "every morning they exchanged polite hellos" [syn: {hello}, {hullo}, {howdy}, {how-do-you-do}] 2: a state in the United States in the central Pacific on the Hawaiian Islands [syn: {Hawaii}, {Aloha State}]
